replies.author: zentol

timeline.bodyText: We usually don't encapsulate singletons. What is the goal behind the holder? (I haven't seen this before)
timeline.author: zentol

replies.bodyText:
It is a trick to ensure the instantiation of the singleton does not incur any race conditions.
This is a safe solution because the class instantiation of the VersionsHolder is guaranteed to be single threaded.
Another way to do this is to make the getVersionsInstance synchronized which makes it needlessly slow.
replies.author: nielsbasjes

replies.bodyText: This is also the reason why the VersionsHolder is private.
replies.author: nielsbasjes

replies.bodyText: Are you saying that having private static final Versions INSTANCE = new Versions(); directly in EnvironmentInformation would not be thread-safe?
replies.author: zentol

replies.bodyText: No that is thread safe too. The way I did it the initialization is done on first use instead of on class loading. Which do you prefer?
replies.author: nielsbasjes

replies.bodyText: Ah, got it. hmm...we usually use the class-loading one I believe, but I suppose  it's fine either way
replies.author: zentol
